org.codefarm.engine

Class CodeGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codefarm.engine.CodeGenerator

  • public class CodeGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    An instance of a generator. The generator produces uniformly distributed, random, and unique BigIntegers in a range from 1 to the maximum permutations of the specified CodeFormat object. The class uses a modified Quadratic Residue function to produce the randomness, with the addition of a randomly generated XOR operand that is used as a one-to-one function to improve the distribution, and to differentiate the sequences of codes from instance to instance.

    Each instance of a CodeGenerator maintains a CodeFormatter object, and is managed in turn by a CodeSpace. A CodeSpace may only be instantiated with one CodeGenerator, but a front end may contain multiple CodeSpaces.

    In any case, with thew addition of the randomly chosen XOR operand, each sequence of codes should be unique between different instances of CodeSpace.

    The main method that this class implements is the next() method, which simply returns the next BigInteger in the sequence.

    Author:
    Oliver Thomas

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeGenerator

        public CodeGenerator(CodeFormatter codeFormatter,
             java.math.BigInteger seed)
        Construct a new instance of CodeGenerator with the specified CodeFormatter and seed value (usually 1)

        The Constructor initialises all the values needed to produce the sequence:

        - The primary number used in the Quadratic Residue Function (_p)

        - The XOR operand used along with the Quadratic Residue Function (_xOrOperand)

        - The maximum permutations of the code space (_maxPerms)

        All these values are declared final as they remain the same for the whole sequence. The only value needed for the generation that is not final is the _x value, the initial value of which can be passed in (the seed value). This value is incremented each time the next() method is called. The initial value of this will usually be 1 and will continue to increment up to the maximum permutations of the code space.

        The XOR operand is produced using the random BigInteger constructor and an instance of Random. This could be extended in future to use an external source of randomness.

        Parameters:
        codeFormatter - The CodeFormatter object to use in the CodeGenerator
        seed - The initial value of _x (usually 1)
